item.title: Israel announces partial national lockdown after coronavirus surge
item.description: Israel will impose a partial national lockdown next week to battle a coronavirus infection surge, the head of its pandemic task force said on Thursday, shouting his exasperation in an emotional television address.

item.title: Two people killed as Typhoon Maysak hits waterlogged North and South Korea
item.description: At least two people were reported killed and thousands were temporarily without power as Typhoon Maysak smashed into the Korean peninsula on Thursday, bringing heavy rain and lashing winds to areas still recovering from Typhoon Bavi.

item.title: RepLeksiyon: Isuko natin ang buong sarili sa Panginoon
item.description: Kapag mayroon kang minamahal, ibibigay mo ang lahat para sa kaniya, isusuko mo sa kaniya ang lahat pati na ang iyong tiwala. (Matt. 16:21-27).

item.title: 'Flying car' sa Japan, ipinasilip sa public demo
item.description: Sa kauna-unahang pagkakataon, ipinasilip sa public demo ng isang Japanese firm ang kanilang "flying car."

item.title: Lebanese army finds more explosive chemicals outside Beirut port after huge blast
item.description: Lebanon's army said on Thursday it had found 4.35 tons of ammonium nitrate near the entrance to Beirut port, the site of a huge blast last month caused by a large stockpile of the same highly explosive chemical.

item.title: Vietnam to resume some Asian flights as curbs on business travel ease
item.description: Vietnam plans to restart international commercial flights to and from six Asian cities from mid-September, state media reported on Thursday, ending months of coronavirus-related suspension after easing some restrictions on foreign business travellers.

item.title: Pulse raises hope of survivor one month after Beirut blast
item.description: Rescue workers dug through rubble in a wrecked district of Lebanon's capital Thursday in search of possible survivors from a mega-blast at the adjacent port one month ago, after scanners detected a pulse.

item.title: Pagdura, pagsinga at iba pang galawang dugyot sa pampublikong lugar, bawal na sa San Juan City
item.description: Ipinagbabawal na ng lokal na pamahalaan ng San Juan City ang mga dugyot na ugali sa mga pampublikong lugar tulad ng pagdura, pagsinga, pag-ihi at pagsuka, bilang pag-iingat pa rin sa pagkalat ng COVID-19

item.title: Lacson: Emergency powers for Duterte to cleanse PhilHealth not necessary
item.description: Senator Panfilo Lacson on Thursday said President Rodrigo Duterte does not need emergency powers to “cleanse” the embattled Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth) of scalawags as he has government agencies at his disposal.

item.title: Malaysia expands entry ban to US, UK, France pass holders
item.description: MalaysiaMalaysia on Thursday added at least nine more countries, including the United States, Britain and France, to its list of long-term immigration pass holders to be barred from the country, national news wire Bernama reported.

item.title: Baguio, Valenzuela, Paranaque are Galvez's top cities for COVID-19 response
item.description: The pandemic response of Baguio, Valenzuela, and Parañaque should be the benchmark of other local governments as the Philippines continues to grapple with the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), Secretary Carlito Galvez Jr. said Thursday.

item.title: Baguio Christmas will not be the same this year, says city administrator
item.description: Several of Baguio s yearly events such as the Christmas tree lighting, concert, Night Market, and much awaited lantern parade may not push through at all.

item.title: Pandemic response probe says it has full access to WHO files
item.description: The group tasked with raking over the World Health Organization-led global response to the coronavirus pandemic revealed Thursday they would have full access to the WHO's records.

item.title: Home quarantines caused COVID-19 community transmission, says Galvez
item.description: “Una na nakita nating lapses ang mga common practice na home quarantine na naging sanhi ng malawakang community transition sa Metro Manila, Region IV-A, Region VII, Iligan, Bacolod at iba pang lugar sa bansa,” Galvez said in a briefing.

item.title: Delivery rider takes online classes on the road
item.description: 21-year-old Ax Valerio went viral on Wednesday after photos of him attending his online class on the side of the road were uploaded on social media by his colleague. Wag po tayong susuko kahit sobrang hirap, laban lang. Kasi sa huli makakamit din naman natin yong gusto natin basta nagsisikap lang,” Valerio added.
